body.p:
Hon T. E. Bramblette.
Governer of Ky

The undersigned your petitioners citizens of Carroll County would respectfully represent that Jessee Carrico a citizen of said county by certain proceedings had before -- Johnson a justice of the peace in Carroll County, was fined // One cent and costs for a breach of the peace. Said fine and costs was paid by said Carrico That afterwards by proceedings had before Samuel Carlisle another justice in said county said Carrico was fined $20, and costs for the same offense. That fifteen days after the rendition of said judgment, when execution had issued, He applied to said justice for an appeal and was informed by said Carlisle that no appeal could be granted 15 days after judgment. Said Carrico is now advised that he can not be tried twice for the same offense and that he had 60 days to take
an appeal from said judgment Your petitioners believing it would be unjust for said Carrico to pay sad fine, Through his ignorance of his legal rights -- and their being now no other redress except an appeal to the executive: respectfully request your excellency to remit said fine.

Jessee Carrico
W. Corn
J H Mershon
A H Ball
M. Brown
William Gelfins
Prentis Meade
B B Elston
S A Berry
G Hish
W Madcaf
S. E. Vancleave
J, W, Ball
John Myrick
We recommend that the request of the petitioners be granted.

W. M. Fisher
H, S, Wright rep elect

Carroll Co
Justice Peace
vs
Jesse Carrico
$20.
Breach Peace
Remit
23d Oct 1865
